message: To anyone who uses Internet Explorer for "Security Reasons" this is for you
story: Muhammad Saleh shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: New Vulnerability Found in Every Single Version of Internet Explorer
caption: gizmodo.com
description: According to a confirmation by Microsoft late last night, a new zero day vulnerability has been found to affect every version of Internet Explorer. In other words—over a quarter of the entire browser market.

data.message: In a bank environment they lock every file upload / download to IE only via some admin stuff. Vulnerabilities are often discovered in every OS and browser (often by white hat hackers / security experts), and they are not a good indication of which is most secure.
Actually, some see it the other way around, since nothing is 100% secure, the browser with least "patched" vulnerabilities might -just might- be simply the most vulnerable.

You may have a point here but Microsoft stopped supporting XP therefore there might wont be a patch for this issue for these users and I don't know if Microsoft will make an exception for this case or not
Also as far as I know Microsoft still didn't release a patch till now which makes us all vulnerable :)
Who the hell uses IE for anything anyway?
26% of the users are still using it unfortunately :)

"IE8 unfortunately regained 0.48 percentage points, and it’s still the world’s most popular browser at 21.73 percent. "
http://thenextweb.com/insider/2014/03/01/ie10-falls-ie9-market-share-firefox-hits-60-month-low-chrome-gains/#!y36N7
